page.title: 16Local History _ Public House
page.content:
We visited a public house in Aigburth Vale. It was called {Ye Olde House At {Home}.
The publican today is a lady called Mrs O'Brien. She gave us a great deal of information about the place.
Part of the building had formerly been a dairy. Certain artefacts had been found there. China dolls heads, an example of scrimshaw and a plate dating from the 1940's showing the two princesses, Elizabeth and Margaret.
She spoke of Hellfire Square, a name given to the place where arguments were settled. We could find no trace of this.
